result.execSummary:
The defendant Constance B Karas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA Surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with Piggly Wiggly or Earl B. - representative from Piggly Wiggly.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a Condition of Probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Constance B Karas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Constance B Karas in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 3 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent.  No contact with Piggly Wiggly or Earl B. - representative from Piggly wiggly.   
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service as a condition of probation.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Constance B Karas in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises his client is in treatment and requests a date for jury status/jury trial. Court grants request.  Defense Attorney has court's standing order regarding jury trials.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Constance B Karas in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests additional time to review discovery with his client.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on June 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Constance B Karas in court.  

Defendant did go to the Public Defender's Officer and does qualify for representation.
However, they were unable to appoint for today's hearing.
  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Constance B Karas in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she hasn't applied at Public Defender's office. Court will give another date in 30 more days.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on April 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Constance B Karas in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation or  Defendant to seek counsel. Court will give another date in 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on March 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on February 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Continue to comply with her WCS program in Milwaukee. Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

Defendant Constance B Karas in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant does not wish to have counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.
